intro: Sinomalus muliensis, commonly known as the Muliensis sinomalus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is typically found in moist, shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical specimen from further decline.
